body:
I reproduced this issue and it affects all maven commands from the Quarkus CLI.

I am debugging

rename.from: Quarkus update from CLI unable to find mvn command
rename.to: Quarkus CLI 3.25 unable to find mvn command

body:
Fix will be in next release, please use Quarkus CLI 3.24 until then:
```bash
jbang app install --name quarkus --force https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/io/quarkus/quarkus-cli/3.24.5/quarkus-cli-3.24.5-runner.jar
```

labels.name: area/platform
labels.description: Issues related to definition and interaction with Quarkus Platform

labels.name: area/devtools
labels.description: Issues/PR related to maven, gradle, platform and cli tooling/plugins

rename.from: Quarkus CLI 3.25 unable to find mvn command
rename.to: Quarkus CLI 3.25 unable to find mvn command (when no ./mvnw)

body: This affects only projects without a maven wrapper (mvnw)

@nikkovacevic could you try the 3.24 (with [this](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/49166#issuecomment-3135943836)) and tell us if it works?

It might be a slightly different issue from the one I fixed

@nikkovacevic actually, I think it's not the same issue than the one @ia3andy is chasing.

Could you tell us which OS you are using?

It would help if you could load the code from https://github.com/smallrye/smallrye-common in an IDE and set a breakpoint in https://github.com/smallrye/smallrye-common/blob/main/process/src/main/java/io/smallrye/common/process/ProcessUtil.java#L89 and see how it goes.

You can start the CLI in debug mode with:

```
JAVA_OPTS="-agentlib:jdwp=transport=dt_socket,server=y,suspend=y,address=*:5005" quarkus dev
```

If you can have a look at what's going on and why it can't find your binary, that would be helpful.
I deleted my first theory as it's incorrect so still very much interested in you trying to debug what's going on in `ProcessUtil`.

@nikkovacevic looking forward to your feedback as that's something I really want to fix as early as possible.

Thanks!
